issue.title: Misleading note about calls to customization points

discussion.p: P0551 (Thou Shalt Not Specialize std Function Templates!) added a clause in [namespace.std]/7:

blockquote.p: Other than in namespace std or in a namespace within namespace std, a program may provide an overload for any library function template designated as a customization point, provided that (a) the overload's declaration depends on at least one user-defined type and (b) the overload meets the standard library requirements for the customization point. (footnote 174) [Note: This permits a (qualified or unqualified) call to the customization point to invoke the most appropriate overload for the given arguments. — end note]

discussion.p: Given that std::swap is a designated customization point, the note seems to suggest the following:
This is not what happens, as the call to std::swap does not find N::swap.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4861.

blockquote.p: -7- Other than in namespace std or in a namespace within namespace std, a program may provide an overload for any library function template designated as a customization point, provided that (a) the overload's declaration depends on at least one user-defined type and (b) the overload meets the standard library requirements for the customization point. (footnote 173) [Note: This permits a (qualified or unqualified) call to the customization point to invoke the most appropriate overload for the given arguments. — end note]
